trustfund: TF022510-PRIVATE POWER DEVELOPMENT,TF023100-PHRD-PRIVATE POWER DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Technical Assistance
            Project for Private Power Development for India was
            unsatisfactory. The project failed to meet its objectives,
            institutional development was negligible, sustainability is
            unlikely, and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower
            was unsatisfactory. Two main lessons can be learned from
            this project. First, more attention should be devoted to
            assessing the real degree of interest in the project on the
            part of the ultimate beneficiaries. Second, the correct
            financial intermediary should be selected. The PFC (Power
            Finance Cooperation) was not the correct intermediary for
            this loan. A direct relationship between the Bank and GOI
            (Government of India) and/or state governments and/or SEBs
            (State Electricity Board) may have produced better results.
            However, at the time that the loan was made, GOI was not
            willing to borrow directly for technical assistance, even if
            the states were to be the final beneficiaries.
